intro: Mariscopsis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, often spiky flower heads and succulent, sometimes fleshy leaves. These plants are typically found in coastal or saline environments, adapting to harsh, salty conditions. Mariscopsis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance. Their botanical features make them well-suited for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
